title: Garba
description: Circular group dance performed during Navratri with rhythmic footwork and drums.

title: Banarasi Weaving
description: Lavish brocade weaving from Varanasi producing silk sarees with gold and silver zari.

title: Kathakali
description: A dramatic dance-theatre form with elaborate makeup, masks and storytelling from Hindu epics.

title: Ikat Weaving
description: A resist-dyeing technique producing characteristic blurred patterns in fabric.

title: Warli Painting
description: Monochrome tribal painting using simple geometric shapes to depict community life.

title: Bharatanatyam
description: A classical temple dance known for fixed upper torso, bent legs and intricate footwork, expressive hand gestures (mudras).

title: Lavani
description: A performance dance combining powerful rhythm, song and dramatic storytelling.

title: Madhubani Painting
description: Intricate folk painting using bold lines and natural dyes, often depicting myths and nature.

title: Pattachitra
description: Traditional scroll painting with mythological themes and fine details.

title: Kalaripayattu
description: One of the worldâ€™s oldest martial arts, combining strikes, kicks and weaponry.

title: Kuchipudi
description: Dance-drama with strong narrative elements and crisp footwork.

title: Blue Pottery (Kota)
description: Distinctive tin-glazed pottery with vibrant blue hues and floral patterns.

title: Tanjore Painting
description: Richly decorated paintings often set with gold foil and gems depicting deities.

title: Yakshagana
description: Vibrant folk theatre combining dance, music and colorful costumes.

title: Thang-Ta (Manipuri Martial Art)
description: Traditional Manipuri martial art with weapons and graceful combat forms.

title: Odissi
description: Fluid, lyrical classical dance with sculptural poses inspired by temple architecture.

title: Ghoomar
description: A graceful spinning folk dance performed by women wearing flowing skirts.

title: Dokra (Dhokra) Metalwork
description: Ancient lost-wax casting technique producing rustic bronze and brass sculptures.

title: Kathak
description: Storytelling dance with rapid spins and expressive gestures, historically performed in royal courts.

title: Chikankari
description: Delicate white-on-white shadow work embroidery originating from Lucknow.

title: Chhau
description: Masked dance with martial elements, dramatic storytelling and vigorous movement.

title: Terracotta Art (Bankura)
description: Vibrant terracotta horses and plaques used in traditional worship and decor.

title: Kutch Embroidery
description: Mirror-work and intricate embroidery from the Kutch region used in garments and decor.

title: Gond Painting
description: Vibrant folk painting characterized by intricate patterns and nature motifs.

title: Pashmina Weaving
description: Fine handspun wool shawls prized for softness and warmth.

title: Manipuri
description: A graceful, devotional dance form often depicting scenes from the life of Krishna.

title: Mohiniyattam
description: A lyrical and feminine dance form with gentle movements and swaying steps.

title: Bhangra
description: Energetic harvest dance known worldwide for powerful rhythms and high energy.

title: Stone Carving (Hampi)
description: Intricate stone architecture and carvings from the Vijayanagara era in Hampi.

title: Sattriya
description: A devotional dance-theatre tradition with roots in Vaishnavite monasteries.
